page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: {AVIEMORE,}a village in Spey Valley, is situated in the{Central Highlands}of Scotland.The climate shows great seasonal variation-with winter temperatures often as low as -25'C. The growing season is short!The surrounding environmental features vary and include forests,lochs,moor- land,farmland and mountains.At 3000ft. the nearby{Cairngorms}are the largest mountain area in Britain.Over the last 25 years this area has become famous for climbing,hillwalking and skiing.A voluntary mountain rescue team is on 24hr call.The development of skiing and tourism led to the establishment of all year round facilities,making Aviemore the largest community in the district(pop.2426).With the opening of the new{A9}road,the Valley has become more easily accessible by both car and Express Coach service.
